00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the literal Number instructions.
00017 
00018 #include <ieee754.hpp>
00019 #include <machine.hpp>
00020 #include <instructions.hpp>
00021 
00022 namespace Instructions {
00023     
00024     /// \name Literals
00025     /// \{
00026     
00027     /// Literal Number.
00028     /**
00029      * \param Int8 The value.
00030      * \return The value as a Number.
00031      */
00032     void LIT8(Machine & machine){
00033         machine.stack.push(machine.nextInt8());
00034     }
00035     
00036     /// Literal Number.
00037     /**
00038      * \param Int16 The value.
00039      * \return The value as a Number.
00040      */
00041     void LIT16(Machine & machine){
00042         machine.stack.push(machine.nextInt16());
00043     }
00044     
00045     /// Literal Number.
00046     /**
00047      * \tparam value The value.
00048      * \return The value as a Number.
00049      */
00050     template<int value>
00051     void LIT_N(Machine & machine){
00052         machine.stack.push(value);
00053     }
00054     
00055     /// Literal Number.
00056     /**
00057      * \param IEEE754binary32 The value.
00058      * \return The value as a Number.
00059      */
00060     void LIT_FLO(Machine & machine){
00061         Int8 float_data[4];
00062         float_data[0] = machine.nextInt8();
00063         float_data[1] = machine.nextInt8();
00064         float_data[2] = machine.nextInt8();
00065         float_data[3] = machine.nextInt8();
00066         machine.stack.push(Number(IEEE754binary32(float_data)));
00067     }
00068     
00069     /// Positive infinity.
00070     /**
00071      * \return \m{+\infty}
00072      */
00073     void INF(Machine & machine){
00074         machine.stack.push(Number_infinity);
00075     }
00076     
00077 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00078     /// Negative infinity.
00079     /**
00080      * \return \m{-\infty}
00081      */
00082     void NEG_INF(Machine & machine){
00083         machine.stack.push(-Number_infinity);
00084     }
00085 #endif
00086     
00087 }
